Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:32 AM Defendant Karl Justin Rein appeared by video from ACJ.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Karl Justin Rein.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def requested to talk to his atty in a breakout room.  On the record 8:37 am.  State argues. Atty objects to evidence.  State comments. Judge rules in favor of the state. Grants motion to allow other acts evidence. Def requests break out room to speak with his atty. Back on the record 8:51 am. Atty advises def that he would prefer that he not directly speak to the judge,  Def speaks to judge about bail modification.  Court advises that def can file a motion for bond modification,

8:22 AM Defendant Karl Justin Rein appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Karl Justin Rein.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF131, 21CF244, 22CF21, and 22CF22.  Atty and def were in a break out session prior to hearing today.  Attorney, here in ACJ for bond, finished initial confinement.  State, 21CF131, seeking dismissal order without prejudice.  Attorney, not objecting to case being dismissed, but with prejudice.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court grants motion to dismiss without prejudice in 21CF131.  Motion of continuance in other cases.  State, asking to make a findings under 971.10(3), comments on motion.  Attorney comments on motion, asking for signature bond today, set up to live at TLU upon release.   State comments.  Court grants continuance of the trial date, stay on the calendar, not setting a signature bond now.  Break out room for def and Atty.  Back on the record at 9:07.  Atty, possible motion for modification of bond.

11:21 AM Defendant Karl Justin Rein appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Karl Justin Rein.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF21, 22CF22, and 21cf244.  State file a motion for joinder and other acts, motion to modify bond.  State, yes.  Atty, joinder believes it is appropriate.  Court motion for joinder is granted.  Motion to modify bond:  State, originally requested signature bonds, has potential release, believes cash bail is warranted, def conduct has been continuous, same victim every time.  Atty, comments on motion to modify bond, asking for leave at signature bond, will be on extended supervision, patient is ill for care outside prison system, asking to deny.  Def going to live in Rice Lake area.  State was extradited to Illinois for 3 cases in 3 different counties, dispositions in those cases, case in MN, Carlton with warrant, from previous information.  Atty comments, unsure of ability to post cash.  Def comments on incidents in Illinois, and comments on warrant in MN and going to court dates for that case.  Court orders $3,000 cash to cover all cases, all non-monetary conditions to are the same from prior bonds.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:01 AM Defendant Karl Justin Rein in court with attorney Thomas Locante.  Defendant Karl Justin Rein in custody from Stanley Correc.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karl Justin Rein appeared by video means with Attorney.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 21CF131,21CF244,22CF21,22CF22-  21CF131- STC, 21CF244-Argn, 22cf21 and 22CF22- Prelim. 
Back on the record (9:11am) Will proceed with the prelim
21CF21 - State calls witness, Officer Hintez, Sworn, exam by the State. Witness identified the def. Ex's 1 and 2 are admitted. Cross exam by the Atty. State makes arguments. Ct finds PC the def committed a fel in Ashland County, 21CF21 is bound over for argnment.
22CF22- State calls witness, Lt. Marten, Sworn, exam by the State.  Witness identified the def. State moves to admitt Ex's 1,2 and 3. Ex's 1,2 and 3 are admitted. Cross exam by Atty. Redirect by the StateAtty makes arguments. Ct finds PC the def committed a fel in Ashland Co. Case 22CF22 is bound over for argnment. 
State has filed info in 21CF21 and asking for a week to file info in 22CF22. 
Atty comments- def is intending to file a sub of Judge. -- if timely sub of Judge req are filed before argn, the hearing will come off the calendar for the new cases (21CF244,22CF21,22CF22)
JA-- set def up to appear from Stanley

09:02 AM Defendant Karl Justin Rein in court with attorney Thomas Locante.  Defendant Karl Justin Rein in custody Def is in Stanley Corr.  Lynne Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 21CF131,21CF244,21CM174,22CF21,22CF22--  22CF21 and 22- are here for INIT, 21CF244 is set for a prelim. 
22CF21 and 22CF22-- Atty is not on the cases, but thinks he will be apt'd.  State moves to dismiss 21CM174, Case is now dismissed without prej. Case has been reissued on a different case. 
21CF244-- Def will waive prelim.   Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt. Back on the record 9:22am  Def and atty were in a break out room, atty rec'd compls, waives reading, asking for a prelim, but will waive TL.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
